main event: On May 26, 1954, an engineer named Ray A. Brantlinger observed a brilliantly illuminated, circular object emitting a reddish-orange glow near his home in Cleveland, Ohio. The object made a straight and level flight, then suddenly accelerated and disappeared from sight. It was estimated to be at an altitude of about 2,000 feet and larger than a B-29 aircraft, approximately 40-50 feet in diameter. It made no sound and seemed to be under intelligent control.
interesting points: The object was observed to make a straight and level flight for about 2 minutes before suddenly accelerating and disappearing from sight.
It emitted a reddish-orange glow and appeared to be self-luminous.
No sound was associated with the object, and it seemed to be under intelligent control.

No other witnesses are known, making Ray A. Brantlinger the sole observer of the object.
